text: Correct me if I’m wrong but <https://www.bitchute.com> is a YouTube except it’s for conspiracy theories?

attachments.title: BitChute is a peer-to-peer social video platform.
attachments.text: BitChute aims to put creators first and provide them with a service that they can use to flourish and express their ideas freely.
attachments.fallback: BitChute: BitChute is a peer-to-peer social video platform.

is a YouTube except it’s for conspiracy theories?

text: It's censorship-free, which means it's full of people who are either very libertarian minded, or have content to crazy/vicious for YouTube to host.

text: A possibly ex friend warned against the coronavirus vaccines and pointed to some speech that this guy has made: <https://www.snopes.com/news/2021/03/26/geert-vanden-bossche/>

attachments.title: Geert Vanden Bossche Stokes Fear of COVID-19 Vaccine To Promote His Own Flawed ‘Solution’
attachments.text: A veterinarian suspiciously says the only way to prevent a COVID-19 vaccine-related calamity is through a product he claims to have invented.
attachments.fallback: Snopes.com: Geert Vanden Bossche Stokes Fear of COVID-19 Vaccine To Promote His Own Flawed ‘Solution’

text: I've only ever seen it linked in the context of crazy conspiracy myths (though there might be other content on there, who knows)

text: I know a good channel on there that does good investigative journalism, even though the creators seem to have certain conspiracies as starting assumptions, they make some great content about real issues too.
Also, it's not p2p currently. AFAIK They do some delivery over web torrent though.
